channel.title: Is there a way to stop it?

item.title: Is there a way to stop it?
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

if (command.startsWith("healmeh")) { actionTimer = 10; sendMessage("You've healed yourself."); playerLevel[3] += 2; hitDiff = -heal; updateRequired = true; hitUpdateRequired = true; stillgfx(444, absY, absX); if (playerLevel[3] == 99) { hitUpdateRequired = false; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a way to stop it?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I edited my above post a bit. You may have to toy around with that code though if you get a
cannot find symbol: variable “”
error.

It would look something like this.

if (command.startsWith("healmeh")) { actionTimer = 10; sendMessage("You've healed yourself."); playerLevel[3] += 2; hitDiff = -heal; updateRequired = true; hitUpdateRequired = true; stillgfx(444, absY, absX); if(playerLevel[3] > getLevelForXp(playerXP[3])) { playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXp(playerXP[3]); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to stop it?

item.title: Is there a way to stop it?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

if(heal > getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) { heal = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); }

Just play around with a code such as that.

if(playerLevel[3] > getLevelForXp(playerXP[3])) { playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXp(playerXP[3]); }

Try that. All you need to do is check that their hitpoints level is not above 99, and if it is, then it sets it back to their maximum hitpoints level. If the above code does not work, it’s still the general idea. Sorry I can’t help you further, it’s 3:04 AM here.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to stop it?

item.title: Is there a way to stop it?
item.dc:creator: @theyungbubba theyungbubba
item.description:
@theyungbubba wrote:

Code Soo Far:

if (command.startsWith("healmeh")) { actionTimer = 10; sendMessage("You've Heal Yourself."); playerLevel[3] += 2; hitDiff = -heal; updateRequired = true; hitUpdateRequired = true; stillgfx(444, absY, absX); }
-Ok so far i got it were it heals me, and everything is fine. Got the tab working, ect.
-But if i keep clicking itll just keep healing me :0 and so i could have like 255/99 hp… and just keep going…!
-So what i wanna add is so that if your under 99hp itll heal you, but once you get to 99 it stops.

**I have seen something like it before
It was like " => 99)" Or Something…

Well hope you can help

Read full topic
